place: 2 Square Robiac, 192 rue de Grenelle, Paris
author: James Joyce
text: Dear Mr Sykes: Do you think you could spare any time to look through the German proofs (page) of Ulysses. I told you about it. The firm has rather rushed the translation and it would be a pity if it contained bad errors as the French translation is almost a masterpiece, they say. I am sending a letter of protest which will interest you Kind regards to Mrs Sykes and yourself from us both Sincerely yours James Joyce
